I first broached this topic as an open-source maintainer for quick-protobuf during my internship with Grasshopper Asia.
I had the opportunity to dissertation about idempotence checking in Ansible scripts. That wasn't too long ago, so in addition to the relevant courses I took during my bachelor's, I'm currently doing self-study while searching for opportunities to get more formally involved in the field.
Currently, I'm broadly interested in formal semantics, logic, type theory and effect systems, with an eye out for HCI factors in language/tool design whenever I get the chance.
In my free time, I also enjoy considering the linguistics of programming, examining how programming idioms, conventions and best practices form and spread over time with usage.
